review: If you are new to setting things up, just be patient.. It will get set up.. The key is -no matter how difficult this first process is for you, just deal with it, you will soon reap a good reward of enjoying it at such an affordable price The wait and anticipation is actually what makes it seem difficult and prone to making mistakes and frustration... I finally got chromecast after years of roku hd, 1 and 3,- yes 3 rokus. You have to get this as an alternative if you are just mirroring googlechrome and playing netfilx, pandora and others. It basically casts (broadcasts)a single tab which you like to the tv while doing other things on other tabs. so cool...I have a HTPC set up, which is multitasking on 2 monitors (surfing or working) and a tv for viewing movies or listening to music etc (3 monitors). This eliminates the need for a 3rd videocard or usb to vga/hdmi adapter in my case. The streaming of netflix and other apps from almost any device/tab/smartphone with this is so much a giveaway given its price compared to roku3 or roku streaming stick. I have yet to try other features if any like browsing local HDD/network content like music and videos, if this can do that this will be jackpot. I have given up with Roku3 on trying to play homevideos a while ago.

author: B Lee Kruegs

review: This is a worthless product!  Installation is a problem (it took me several hours to get it to work, since on initial startup it immediately launched an update program that hung up and required multiple restarts), the "chromecasting" either wouldn't start at all, would hang, or would work intermittently, THEN hang up and require restarting [always from the beginning of the program], and of course it won't work with certain types of hardware and software (on the latter score, Windows XP isn't supported).  The idea is pretty good (use your large TV screen to view internet-streamed content), but with the development of integrated systems, probably won't be useful for very long), but the implementation is very buggy.  I wouldn't recommend it unless you have particular interest or ability in modifying and debugging to make it work.
